examples.input: A man is facing west. He turns 45 degrees in the clockwise direction and then another 180 degrees in the same direction and then 270 degrees in anti-clockwise direction. Which direction is he facing now?
examples.reason: A 45 degree clockwise turn from West will be North-west. Then 180 degrees turn in clockwise direction will be south-east. Now 270 degrees turn in anti-clockwise direction will be south-west. So he is facing South-west now.

examples.input: If you are facing North-east and move 10m forward, turn left and move 7.5m, then turn right and move 15m, and finally turn opposite and move 2m. Now you take 135 degrees turn in clockwise direction. Which direction are you facing now?

examples.input: A river flows west to east and on the way turns left and then goes in a semi circle round a hillock. Then turns left at right angle. Which direction is river flowing?
examples.reason: The river flows towards east at first. Left from east will be north. A semi-circle turn will mean a 180 degree turn which will be south. Then left from south will be East again. So the river is flowing towards East.

examples.input: A man is facing North. He turns 45 degrees in anti-clockwise direction then 135 degrees in clockwise direction. He then turns again 585 degrees in clockwise direction. Which direction is he facing now?
examples.reason: 45 degrees anti-clockwise from North will be North-west. From here 135 degrees in clockwise direction will be East. Since 360 degrees means the same direction, 585 degrees in clockwise direction will be 585 - 360 = 225 degrees in clockwise direction. Which is same as 225 - 180 = 45 degrees in clockwise direction from the opposite. Hence opposite from East is west, 45 degrees in clockwise direction will be North-west.

examples.input: A man is facing North. He turns 45 degrees in anti-clockwise direction then 135 degrees in clockwise direction. He then turns again 585 degrees in clockwise direction. Which direction is opposite to him?
examples.reason: 45 degrees anti-clockwise from North will be North-west. From here 135 degrees in clockwise direction will be East. Since 360 degrees means the same direction, 585 degrees in clockwise direction will be 585 - 360 = 225 degrees in clockwise direction. Which is same as 225 - 180 = 45 degrees in clockwise direction from the opposite. Hence opposite from East is west, 45 degrees in clockwise direction will be North-west. Opposite from North-west is South-east.
